1.title: West Bromwich Albion v Manchester United
1.plot: Sir Alex Ferguson?s tenure in charge of Manchester United ended with a thrilling 5-5 draw with West Bromwich Albion at the Hawthorns on the final day of the Barclays Premier League season.

2.title: Newcastle United v Sunderland
2.plot: Sunderland have secured their first win under new manager Paolo di Canio, beating local rivals Newcastle United 3-0 in the Tyne-Wear derby.

3.title: West Ham United v Tottenham Spurs
3.plot: This was the night when West Ham remembered Bobby Moore 20 years after his passing yet their hopes of securing the win that would have served as a perfect tribute to the former club captain were ruined by Tottenham's own legend in the making. Gareth Bale scored yet another brilliant last-gasp winner to move Tottenham Hotspur up to third.

4.title: Arsenal v Newcastle United
4.plot: Theo Walcott gave Arsene Wenger yet another reminder of his goalscoring talents as he netted a stunning hat-trick to sink Newcastle United in a 10-goal thriller at the Emirates Stadium.

5.title: Chelsea v Aston Villa
5.plot: Christmas came slightly early for the Blues. 7 scorers supplied the 8 goals with Fernando Torres setting the team on its way with a fine early header. David Luiz and Branislav Ivanovic made it 3-0 by the break and after the interval Frank Lampard scored his 130th Chelsea top-flight league goal to set a new club record.

6.title: Manchester City v Manchester United
6.plot: Robin van Persie's injury-time winner sent Manchester United six points clear at the top of the Premier League after a stormy derby win against Manchester City at the Etihad Stadium.

7.title: Arsenal v Tottenham Spurs
7.plot: A moment of madness from Emmanuel Adebayor sparked a spectacular Tottenham collapse as Arsenal romped to a 5-2 victory in an entertaining north London derby at the Emirates Stadium.

8.title: Liverpool v Tottenham Spurs
8.plot: Steven Gerrard struck a late penalty winner as Liverpool kept their hopes of claiming a Champions League berth alive with a rollercoaster 3-2 win over Tottenham at Anfield.

9.title: Chelsea v Manchester United
9.plot: Manchester United ended their 10-year wait for a Barclays Premier League win away to Chelsea with a 3-2 victory that cut their opponents' lead at the top to one point.

10.title: Manchester City v Southampton
10.plot: It was deja vu for Manchester City as the Barclays Premier League champions opened their title defence with a thrilling 3-2 victory over newly promoted Southampton.

imdb.title: Premier League Classic Matches 2012/2013
plot: 10 Premier League Classic Matches from 2012/2013 Season.
